intro: Neoxythece schulzii, commonly known as the Schultze's lily, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, showy flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant features strap-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers with prominent stamens. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
